Sentencas: The objective of this paper is to illustrate a variety of studies carried out to improve the quality of some particular glass-ceramic joining materials based on measured properties such as gas-tightness and mechanical resistance and demonstrate the feasibility of using the proposed materials for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) and solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOEC) applications.
Titulo: Thermo-Mechanical Stability and Gas-Tightness of Glass-Ceramics Joints for SOFC in the System MgO-BaO/SrO-B2O3-SiO2

Sentencas: First, the sealing conditions have been optimized for the two selected compositions in the system MgO-BaO/SrO-B2O3-SiO2.
Titulo: Thermo-Mechanical Stability and Gas-Tightness of Glass-Ceramics Joints for SOFC in the System MgO-BaO/SrO-B2O3-SiO2

Sentencas: Once the joining materials have been optimized, the gas-tightness has been measured as a function of the glass-ceramic crystallization degree, its thermal cycling behavior and the influence of a reducing atmosphere on this property.
Titulo: Thermo-Mechanical Stability and Gas-Tightness of Glass-Ceramics Joints for SOFC in the System MgO-BaO/SrO-B2O3-SiO2

Sentencas: The electrical resistance at high temperature has also been studied.
Titulo: Thermo-Mechanical Stability and Gas-Tightness of Glass-Ceramics Joints for SOFC in the System MgO-BaO/SrO-B2O3-SiO2

Sentencas: Subsequently, the chemical compatibility of the joints steel/glass-ceramic has been evaluated by means of the analysis of the cross-sections using SEM and EDX.
Titulo: Thermo-Mechanical Stability and Gas-Tightness of Glass-Ceramics Joints for SOFC in the System MgO-BaO/SrO-B2O3-SiO2

Sentencas: Furthermore, the mechanical and chemical stability of the joints has also been studied as a function of the crystallization degree, the resistance vs. thermal cycling and the influence of a reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Thermo-Mechanical Stability and Gas-Tightness of Glass-Ceramics Joints for SOFC in the System MgO-BaO/SrO-B2O3-SiO2

Sentencas: Finally, the mechanical resistance of the joints regarding flexural loading has been characterized employing a 4-point bending method both at room temperature and at relevant high temperatures varying the seal thickness.
Titulo: Thermo-Mechanical Stability and Gas-Tightness of Glass-Ceramics Joints for SOFC in the System MgO-BaO/SrO-B2O3-SiO2

Sentencas: Overall, the results verify that the developed and tested materials are promising for long term stable SOFC and SOEC applications in advanced stack designs aiding prolonged lifetime under thermal-cyclic conditions.
Titulo: Thermo-Mechanical Stability and Gas-Tightness of Glass-Ceramics Joints for SOFC in the System MgO-BaO/SrO-B2O3-SiO2
